title: 24 Memes for “Adults” Stuck Between a Job and a Hard Place
description: Let's start with the good news. We're all in the same boat here, navigating the same narrative, living in the same timeline. Solidarity, right? The bad news is that the boat is the Titanic, the setting is Groundhog Day, and nobody's getting off. Not exactly the inspirational pep talk you were hoping for, but hey, at least we're sinking together. Over and over again.Unfortunately for us, we've landed in a time of limbo. We're all stuck. If you want to feel a little better about it, just think of yourself as a Greek myth—you're Sisyphus. Hooray! Us modern mythical beings seem to exist in two states: either desperately looking (or let's be honest, begging) for a job or hating the one we already have. Yay! It's like a rollercoaster ride with one single loop that just repeats forever. Thrilling.
author: Etai Eshet
excerpt: 24 Memes for “Adults” Stuck Between a Job and a Hard Place - The internet has generated a huge amount of laughs from cats and FAILS. And we all out of cats.
text: Think of it this way: we’re either rolling the rock up the hill with optimism and LinkedIn notifications or watching it tumble back down as we refresh our inbox for rejection emails or endure another pointless meeting about optimizing synergy. But hey, we’re mythical now. That’s something. We just need to imagine ourselves happy while pushing that rock and pretending not to cry in the office bathroom.If this all feels too bleak, don’t worry, we’ve got memes to remind you that you’re not alone on this sinking ship. Scroll through these gems and laugh at the absurdity of our shared existence. Because if we can’t laugh at our never-ending loop of adulting misery, what else can we do?
html:
Think of it this way: we’re either rolling the rock up the hill with optimism and LinkedIn notifications or watching it tumble back down as we refresh our inbox for rejection emails or endure another pointless meeting about optimizing synergy. But hey, we’re mythical now. That’s something. We just need to imagine ourselves happy while pushing that rock and pretending not to cry in the office bathroom.

If this all feels too bleak, don’t worry, we’ve got memes to remind you that you’re not alone on this sinking ship. Scroll through these gems and laugh at the absurdity of our shared existence. Because if we can’t laugh at our never-ending loop of adulting misery, what else can we do?
